item.title: 卢特尼克称，特朗普计划在贸易战中对豁免电子产品单独征税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周日表示，智能手机、电脑和其他一些电子产品刚刚被免除了从中国进口的高额关税，它们将在未来两个月内与半导体产品一起面临单独的新关税。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday that smartphones, computers and some other electronics, just exempted from steep tariffs on imports from China, would face separate new duties along with semiconductors within the next two months.】

item.title: 美国商务部长称豁免电子产品将被单独征收关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周日在接受美国广播公司（ABC）"本周 "节目采访时表示，智能手机、电脑和其他一些电子产品将被单独征收关税，半导体也可能在一个月左右被征收关税。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday in an interview with ABC's "This Week" that smartphones, computers and some other electronics will come under separate tariffs, along with semiconductors that may be imposed in a month or so.】

item.title: 报道称，韩国浦项制铁考虑加入现代钢铁公司在美国投资 58 亿美元的钢铁厂项目
item.description: 周日的新闻报道称，韩国钢铁制造商浦项制铁正在考虑加入现代钢铁公司在路易斯安那州建造一座价值58亿美元工厂的项目，因为该国钢铁行业正试图应对美国对该行业征收的关税。【原文：South Korean steelmaker POSCO is considering joining a project by Hyundai Steel to build a $5.8 billion plant in Louisiana as the country's steel industry tries to respond to U.S. tariffs on the sector, news reports said on Sunday.】

item.title: 英国表示，任何美英贸易协定都不会放松食品标准
item.description: 英国商业大臣乔纳森-雷诺兹（Jonathan Reynolds）周日表示，英国不会放松食品安全标准，作为任何降低对美出口关税协议的一部分。【原文：Britain will not relax its food safety standards as part of any deal to secure lower tariffs on its exports to the United States, business minister Jonathan Reynolds said on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国如何从讨好特朗普到 "绝不屈服 "关税挑衅
item.description: 对于试图避免贸易战升级的中国政府来说，这种好斗的态度标志着一个艰难的转折。【原文：The combative approach marked a hard turn for Beijing, which had tried to avoid a spiraling trade war.】

item.title: 印度 TCS 称零售和旅游客户更易受美国关税动荡影响
item.description: 印度塔塔咨询服务公司首席执行官告诉路透社，该公司在零售、旅游和汽车行业的客户更容易受到美国关税的影响，如果不确定性持续存在，他们可能会采取削减成本的措施。【原文：Clients of India's Tata Consultancy Services in the retail, travel and automobile sectors are more exposed to fallout from U.S. tariffs and they may resort to cost-cutting if uncertainty persists, the company's CEO told Reuters.】

item.title: 日本执政党党首呼吁加强日元汇率
item.description: 日本执政党政策负责人周日表示，由于日元疲软推高了家庭生活成本，日本必须加强日元汇率，例如帮助提高该国的工业竞争力。【原文：Japan must strengthen the yen, such as by helping boost the country's industrial competitiveness, as the currency's weakness has pushed up households' living costs, the ruling party's policy chief said on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将在周一提供更多有关芯片关税的信息
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周六表示，他将在下周一就其政府对半导体关税的态度提供最新消息。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday that he will provide an update on his administration's approach to semiconductor tariffs on Monday.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院允许裁员，但不允许解散消费者监督机构
item.description: 一家上诉法院周五裁定，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府可以解雇美国消费者金融保护局（CFPB）的工作人员，但不能取消该机构。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration could lay off workers at the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), but not abolish the agency, an appeals court ruled on Friday.】

item.title: 美国将智能手机和电脑排除在互惠关税之外
item.description: 根据美国海关和边境保护局周五晚些时候公布的一份物品清单，美国已将智能手机和电脑等某些电子产品排除在唐纳德-特朗普总统的互惠关税之外。【原文：The United States has excluded certain electronics like smartphones and computers from President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs, according to a list of items published by the U.S. Customs and Border Protection late Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，KKR 接近达成以约 30 亿美元收购 OSTTRA 的交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六援引知情人士的话报道，美国私募股权公司 KKR 接近达成以约 30 亿美元收购 OSTTRA 的交易。【原文：U.S.-based private equity firm KKR is nearing a deal to buy OSTTRA for about $3 billion, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 这个座位要花多少钱？美国企业已看到特朗普关税的影响
item.description: 一位玩具店经理每天都收到涨价通知。一家润唇膏生产商预测商品成本将飙升 500 万美元。一位音乐会演出场所的经营者，他发现在演出大厅安装新座椅的价格突然上涨了 14 万美元。【原文：A toy store manager hit with daily price increase notifications. A lip balm manufacturer forecasts a $5 million jump in cost of goods. A concert venue impresario who saw a surprise price hike of $140,000 to install new seats in a performance hall.】

item.title: 特朗普贸易团队在 90 天内达成 90 项交易。专家称祝你好运
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府希望在 90 天内达成 90 项贸易协议，但要迅速解决总统的贸易战所面临的挑战已经显而易见。【原文：President Donald Trump's administration wants to strike 90 trade deals in 90 days, but the challenges to quickly resolving the president's trade war are already apparent.】

item.title: 美国关税引发市场动荡，台湾延长卖空禁令
item.description: 台湾最高金融监管机构周六表示，在美国关税引发动荡后，将把卖空的临时限制措施再延长一周，以确保市场稳定，并补充说这些限制措施很有帮助。【原文：Taiwan's top financial regulator said on Saturday it would extend temporary curbs on short-selling for another week to ensure market stability after U.S. tariffs unleashed turmoil, adding that the restrictions had been helpful.】

item.title: 台湾与美国举行首次关税谈判
item.description: 台湾政府周六表示，台湾官员周五与美国官员举行了首次关税谈判。【原文：Taiwanese officials held their first tariff talks with U.S. officials on Friday, the island's government said on Saturday.】

item.title: 三星和越南在特朗普关税战中的损失
item.description: 三星电子董事长李在镕今年 7 月会见越南总理时，传达了一个简单的信息。【原文：When Samsung Electronics chairman Jay Y. Lee met Vietnam's prime minister in July, he had a simple message to convey.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称，在与特朗普的加密货币公司进行交易谈判期间，Binance 试图遏制美国的监督
item.description: 华尔街日报》称，Binance 高管上个月会见了美国财政部官员，讨论了放松政府对该公司监管的问题，同时探讨了与唐纳德-特朗普总统的加密货币企业 World Liberty Financial 开展业务交易。【原文：Binance executives met U.S. Treasury officials last month and discussed loosening government oversight of the company, while exploring a business deal with President Donald Trump’s crypto venture, World Liberty Financial, the Wall Street Journal said.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，Alphabet 和 Nvidia 投资 OpenAI 联合创始人 Sutskever 的 SSI 公司
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士称，Alphabet 和 Nvidia 已加入知名风险投资者的行列，支持由 OpenAI 前首席科学家伊利亚-苏茨克沃（Ilya Sutskever）联合创办的初创公司 Safe Superintelligence（SSI）。【原文：Alphabet and Nvidia have joined prominent venture capital investors to back Safe Superintelligence (SSI), a startup co-founded by OpenAI's former chief scientist Ilya Sutskever that has quickly risen to become one of the most valuable artificial intelligence startups months after its launch, a source familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 一群前 OpenAI 员工支持马斯克停止 OpenAI 重组的诉讼
item.description: 周五，十几名 OpenAI 前员工提交了一份法律简报，支持联合创始人埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）旨在保持 OpenAI 非营利地位的诉讼，这标志着有关这家人工智能公司未来的争议有了最新进展。【原文：A dozen former OpenAI employees filed a legal brief on Friday backing co-founder Elon Musk's lawsuit aimed at keeping the non-profit status of OpenAI, marking the latest development in the dispute over the future of the artificial intelligence firm.】

item.title: 美国芯片制造商外包生产将逃避中国关税
item.description: AMD 和 Nvidia 的股价分别上涨了 6% 和 2.6%，而高通公司则上涨了 1.1%。据中国芯片制造商信息论坛称，美国公司将能把其芯片产地归类为台湾。【原文：Shares of AMD and Nvidia - rose 6% and 2.6% respectively, while Qualcomm was up 1.1%. The US companies will be able to have their chip origin classified as Taiwan, according to an info forum for Chinese chipmakers.】

item.title: Meta 将增补 Dina Powell McCormick 和 Patrick Collison 为董事会成员
item.description: Meta Platforms 社交媒体公司周五表示，前共和党官员迪娜-鲍威尔-麦考密克（Dina Powell McCormick）和金融科技公司 Stripe 首席执行官帕特里克-科里森（Patrick Collison）将加入公司董事会，自 4 月 15 日起生效。【原文：Meta Platforms will add former Republican official Dina Powell McCormick and fintech firm Stripe's CEO Patrick Collison to its board, effective April 15, the social media company said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，世界银行将宣布为阿根廷提供 120 亿美元的一揽子融资计划
item.description: 一位知情人士透露，世界银行准备在周五宣布向阿根廷提供 120 亿美元的一揽子融资计划，以补充国际货币基金组织预计批准的 200 亿美元阿根廷贷款协议。【原文：The World Bank is poised to announce a $12 billion financing package for Argentina on Friday, supplementing the International Monetary Fund's expected approval of a $20 billion Argentina loan deal, a source with knowledge of the plan said.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，CVC 探讨以 750 亿美元竞购美国私人贷款机构 Golub Capital
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引几位知情人士的话报道称，欧洲私募股权公司 CVC 正在探讨以 750 亿美元收购私人信贷机构 Golub Capital。【原文：European private equity firm CVC is exploring a $75 billion deal for private credit lender Golub Capital , the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing several people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 消息人士称，A16z 有意领投前 OpenAI 首席技术官的初创公司 Thinking Machines 的巨额融资
item.description: 据四位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，硅谷风险投资公司安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）正在与前 OpenAI 首席技术官米拉-穆拉蒂（Mira Murati）的初创公司进行谈判，以主导其早期阶段的大规模融资。【原文：Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz is in talks to lead an outsized early stage funding round of former OpenAI chief technology officer Mira Murati's startup, according to four sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 阿根廷放宽外汇管制，在国际货币基金组织（IMF）达成协议前进行重大政策调整
item.description: 阿根廷中央银行周五宣布将放松外汇市场管制，允许比索在1美元兑1000至1400比索的波动区间内自由波动。【原文：Argentina's central bank announced on Friday that it will ease its foreign exchange market controls, allowing the peso to freely fluctuate within a moving band of between 1,000 and 1,400 pesos per dollar.】

item.title: 交易日 本周美国债券和美元大跌
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 联合健康要求医疗服务提供商偿还黑客贷款
item.description: 据两家医疗服务提供商周五透露，联合健康集团要求医疗服务提供商偿还去年其技术部门 Change Healthcare 遭到网络攻击后从该公司获得的贷款。【原文：UnitedHealth Group is demanding that healthcare providers repay the loans they received from the company after a cyberattack at its tech unit Change Healthcare last year, according to two providers on Friday.】

item.title: 总裁警告：油价下跌可能使 Ecopetrol 全年利润减少 28 亿美元
item.description: 哥伦比亚国营石油公司 Ecopetrol 总裁周五警告说，油价下跌可能使该公司今年的利润减少高达 12 万亿比索（27.6 亿美元）。【原文：Lower oil prices could reduce Colombian state-run oil firm Ecopetrol's profits by up to 12 trillion pesos ($2.76 billion) this year, the company's president warned on Friday.】

item.title: 阿根廷大豆曾一度枯竭，如今却雨水充沛
item.description: 业内专家表示，阿根廷农业中心地带的暴雨导致田地被淋湿，这引发了人们对大豆损失和 2024/25 年度大豆销售延迟的担忧，尽管即将到来的干燥天气应该会给生产者带来宽慰。【原文：Drenched Argentine fields due to heavy rains in the country's farm heartland are raising fears of soybean losses and delayed sales of the 2024/25 crop, although drier weather on the horizon should bring relief to producers, industry experts said.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 资产波动扩大加剧关税困扰美股的担忧
item.description: 全球市场的剧烈波动将使美国股市投资者在未来一周处于紧张状态，因为美元疲软和国债抛售加剧了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推出全面关税政策后爆发的股市剧烈波动。【原文：Wild swings in global markets are poised to keep U.S. stock investors on edge in the coming week, as a weakening dollar and a selloff in Treasuries compound extreme equity volatility that erupted after President Donald Trump launched his sweeping tariffs.】
